contentrichtext.text: '''''Queen of the Elephants''''' is a book authored by the [[conservation movement|conservationist]] and travel writer [[Mark Shand]] and the corresponding [[BBC]] documentary ''Queen of the Elephants'', based on the life of the first female mahout in recent timesâ€”[[Parbati Barua]] of [[Kaziranga]]. The book went on to win the 1996 [[Thomas Cook Travel Book Award]] and the [[:fr:Prix_litt%C3%A9raire_de_Trente_millions_d'amis|Prix Litteraire d'Amis]], providing free publicity simultaneously to the profession of mahouts, and to Kaziranga.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1050313/asp/look/story_4480991.asp |title=Wild at heart |accessdate=2007-06-26 |author=Anupam Bordoloi |publisher=The Telegraph (Calcutta, India edition) website }}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Indian biographies]]
